case_study.title: AI-Powered Roof Detection: 60x Faster Solar Proposals

at_a_glance.impact: 60x designer productivity improvement, $40k ARR from 6 new customers

case_study.problem: Solar designers spent 15-20 minutes manually tracing each roof using satellite imagery, Google Street View, and 3D spatial data. This bottleneck limited how many proposals each designer could generate, directly impacting revenue and project timelines. Sales teams couldn't scale. Onboarding new designers took weeks. Most neighborhoods got ignored because teams only had capacity to quote "sure bet" homes.
case_study.solution: Built an AI-powered roof detection system that automatically identifies and segments roof faces in under 20 seconds with 92% accuracy. Designers now generate proposals 60x faster.

my_role.dataset_strategy: Analyzed failed detections to identify quality issues in initial 60k training dataset. Designed experiment-driven approach: prioritized 3 edge cases (complex geometries, shadows, low-quality imagery). Result: Cut dataset to 15k high-quality images while dramatically improving model performance.
my_role.execution: Coordinated ML engineer (Ankit Gupta) and engineering lead across 9-month timeline. Navigated technical limitations through iterative experimentation vs. brute-force data collection. Shipped to production on time despite pivoting from quantity (60k) to quality (15k) approach.
my_role.gtm: Drove adoption with 6 new customer organizations within first 6 months. Enabled new sales motion: 'Canvas entire neighborhoods, not just cherry-picked homes.' Reduced new designer onboarding from weeks to days.

impact.designers: 95% time reduction: 15-20 minutes → 20 seconds per roof design
impact.sales: 60x productivity: Sales teams can now generate proposals for entire neighborhoods instead of select homes
impact.business: $40k ARR: 6 new customer organizations signed within 6 months post-launch

learnings: Quality > Quantity in AI Products: Our breakthrough came from cutting our dataset by 75% and focusing on edge cases, not collecting more data. This required discipline—resisting the 'let's just train on everything' instinct and instead running targeted experiments to understand failure modes.

AI Product Leadership = Constraint Navigation: Technical limitations (model accuracy on complex roofs) and data quality issues could have derailed the project. Success came from reframing these as product decisions: Which edge cases matter most? Where's the 80/20? What's 'good enough' for production?
case_study.status: In production and actively used by all 6 customer organizations. Currently expanding training dataset for next iteration based on production learnings.
